section.title: What's this about?
section.para: In this chapter you will learn to use our powerful shapecreator tool. It allows easy creation and editing of shapes. Therefore, it supports you in any possible way: It provides a visual live preview, exact coordinate positioning, collision testing and a huge list of templates.

section.title: Handling the viewport
section.para: The drawing panel on the right side is the central point of editing. You can see the final shape here and interact with your mouse.
The panel allows you several ways to change your view on the shape:

listitem.para: Hold the right mouse button and drag the mouse to move the panel.
Scroll the mouse wheel up to zoom in and down to zoom out.

You can also press CTRL-1, CTRL-2,..., CTRL-5 to directly zoom to 1x, 2x, ... 5x zoom. Use CTRL-+ to increase zoom by 0.5 and CTRL-- to decrease by 0.5. To enter a custom zoom value, press Z and enter any custom value greater 0.1.

section.para: You can go to View -> Reset view at anytime to reset the zoom and center the shape.

section.title: Editing the shape
section.para: Editing shapes with the shapecreator is a very simple task. Make sure that your shapes match the shape criteria described later on so your shape will not blow up the game.

section.title: Edit modes
section.para: Dragging vertices is possible in every mode. You can select a vertice by clicking on the table row or click on the shape edge (this is not available in delete mode).

note.para: Vertice table and viewport are synchronized.
This means selecting a table row results in the correspondent vertice to be highlighted in the viewport. Coordinates are updated immediately, too!

section.para: There are provided two (actually three) editing modes to modify the shape.

listitem.para: In this mode, you can click into the viewport to add a new vertice at the end of the list.
This is kind of a no-mode that allows you to drag vertices and change the viewport without adding or deleting vertices.
In this mode, you can click on existing vertices to remove them. This will result that the former and next vertice will be connected.

section.title: Shape templates
section.para: The shapecreator provides a template system that allows you to start creating a shape using a template. Simple templates are nothing else than a shape saved in a special format. There are parametrized templates, too. These allow the user to customize them before usage, for example using the circle template, users can specify radius and vertice count.
